snippet: Sergei L. Magnitsky, a lawyer who was jailed as he tried to expose government tax fraud, died four years ago in a Russian prison after being denied proper medical care.
abstract: Sergei L Magnitsky, lawyer who was jailed for trying to expose government tax fraud and who died in jail in 2009, is found guilty of tax fraud in Russia's first trial of a dead man; Magnitsky's death, after being denied proper medical care, drew international condemnation and prompted United States to bar Russians accused of human rights violations from traveling to America or maintaining financial assets there.
lead_paragraph: Sergei L. Magnitsky, a lawyer who was jailed as he tried to expose government tax fraud, died four years ago in a Russian prison after being denied proper medical care.

headline.main: Dead Lawyer, a Kremlin Critic, Is Found Guilty of Tax Evasion
headline.print_headline: Dead Lawyer, a Kremlin Critic, Is Found Guilty of Tax Evasion

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
